vals.name: para0
vals.text: Having installed Catalyst, the Perl MVC framework, these modules implement some controllers and data models that should be useful to many web applications

vals.name: para2
vals.text: Web application developers writing for the corporate intranet. The Identity data model uses the OS user database, providing methods to authenticate, create, and update accounts. It is assumed that this is appropriate for the target audience although the model allows for different storage databases to be used instead

vals.name: para4
vals.text: * Skins Selected from the tools menu a skin contains the CSS, TT template, and Javascript files used to present the pages of this application. These files control font selection, colours, content positioning, and interactive behaviour. Replace the contents of the image files as required, the one TT template contains the HTML element container relationships for all pages * XML configuration editors All of the textual content is stored XML files for which editors are provided within the application. The application name 'Munchies' can be altered from Admin > Configuration page. MyApp becomes YourApp, MyCompany becomes YourCompany, etc. This text can be altered from the Admin > Configuration > Messages page * Internationalization With all the literal text stored in XML files and copies translated into multiple languages, providing localised applications is straightforward

vals.name: para0
vals.text: Think of this system as a building. It has a navigation bar that provides access to all levels within the building. Each level contains one or more rooms. The reception room on each level contains more information about that level

vals.name: para1
vals.text: At the top of each room is a title bar. Beneath that there is the navigation bar. When you click the icon on the navigation bar it expands/collapses the side panel. Mousing over a link on the navigation bar will display more information about that level after a short delay. Clicking on a link will take you to that level

vals.name: para2
vals.text: The second and subsequent items on the navigation bar allow you enter the different rooms on the current level. Some rooms do not appear until a record has been selected in the current room

vals.name: para3
vals.text: If you try to enter a room not open to anonymous access you wil be redirected to User Authentication on the Entrance level. There you will be forced to prove your identity by entering your login id and password. Levels requiring authentication will not appear on the navigation bar if user identity is unknown. Your current identity is shown in bottom right corner of the footer bar followed by some useful numbers

vals.name: para4
vals.text: Near the top right corner of the room are some clickable icons. The icon is a drop menu containing options that affect the way the user interface works. The Turn Footer On/Off option toggles the footer display. The Feedback option creates a mail message with a context sensitive subject string. This message allows you to share your experience of Munchies Development with it's administrators. The Feedback option only appears if your identity is known. The icon will display the relevant help text for the current room in another browser window. The icon will reset your identity to unknown, exit the building and return you to the root page of this web server
